TopicTitle: Mod to indicate relative performance per mod DLL?

Articles.Content:
Just wondering if there was any thing or ideas out there that someonne knows that can / could indicate what DLL is utilizing processing resources relative to all other mods that are installed?

Sure I'm not alone with the issue of pushing the number of mods a bit too far. Then there is the task of trying to unravel the knot I've make for myself. Deciding what mod/s to remove so I can get back into "green" time is not fun with all the restarts to check for minimal performance differences and weigh up it I 'really' want that QoL mod or not...

Figured I'd ask if there was a performance metric for mods that could be used for installed mods to aid this decision process? # module calls per second? Processing duration? No idea but thought it worth a discussion that might prompt something of an idea from the community.
